content:
• Tuesday, December 6, 2016
  • FCE.A

    Forest City soars following sweeping changes

    • Forest City Class A shares gained 10%, and Class B shares jumped 37% after it announced sweeping changes.
    • FC says it will recommend that shareholders approve a proposal to eliminate its dual-class share structure.
    • Under the terms of the proposed reclassification, all of the outstanding shares of the Company's Class B Common Stock would be converted into shares of the Company's Class A Common Stock, and holders of Class B shares will exchange each of their Class B shares for 1.31 shares of Class A Common Stock. In connection with the reclassification, RMS, Limited Partnership ("RMS"), the controlling shareholder of the Company's Class B shares, has agreed to vote all shares of Class B shares owned by it in favor of the proposal, representing a majority of the Class B shares outstanding.
    • "Today's announcement will strengthen the Company's corporate governance profile by aligning voting rights with the economic interests of all our shareholders," FC says.
    • FC also shuffled its board.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: PLAY +12.2%. WDC +5.6%. CATB +2.4%. TERP +1.6%. STX +1.6%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: LADR -9.6%. ESV -6.1%. JPEP -4.9%. CS -3.4%. NDRM -2.9%.

  • PES

    Pioneer Energy Services to launch 9M-share offering

    • Pioneer Energy Services (NYSE:PES) -6.7% AH after announcing a public offering of 9M common shares, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 1.35M shares.
    • PES says it plans to use the proceeds to pay down debt outstanding under its senior secured revolving credit facility.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM | 20 Comments
  • WDC

    Western Digital raises Q2 guidance, renews cross-license arrangement with Samsung; +4.3% after hours

    • Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) updates on revenue, now expecting $4.75B over $4.7B prior, gross margin, now at 36% over 35%, operating and net interest expenses, with respective expectations of $805M and $205M to remain unchanged, tax rate, to 13% from 14%, and EPS, to $2.10-$2.15 from $1.85-$1.95. Full release of the company's Q2 report is scheduled for late January.
    • Separately notes a royalty-bearing agreement with Samsung Electronics (OTC:SSNLF) has been renewed for the cross-licensing of both companies' semiconductor patent portfolios, predominantly covering multi-level flash memory and flash storage systems. Renewed collaboration to remain effective through December 31, 2024.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM
  • NDRM

    NeuroDerm readies equity offering; shares off 3% after hours

    • NeuroDerm (NASDAQ:NDRM) eases 3% after hours on light volume in response to its announcement that it has launched a follow-on offering of ordinary shares. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced. Net proceeds will fund clinical trials, R&D and general corporate purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • SIG

    Signet drops after Corvex pares stake

    • Signet Jewelers (NYSE:SIG) falls 1.2% in AH trading after hedge fund Corvex reports a reduce stake in the company.
    • Corvex now holds a  4.97% position in Signet.
    • SEC Form 13D
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • OHAI

    OHA Investment discloses trouble with two big investments

    • Bennu Oil & Gas (the successor to ATP Oil & Gas) filed for Chapter 7 bankruptcy on Dec. 1, indicating its intention to liquidate. The bankruptcy is expected to have a material negative impact on OHAI's royalty interest, which was $12.3M, representing 9.4% of the total fair value of the company's portfolio as of the end of Q3.
    • On Nov. 30, OHA entered into a fifth amendment to its note wit OCI Holdings allowing interest to be paid in-kind for November. This came after a Texas agency announced Medicaid reimbursement reductions which are likely to have a negative impact on OCI's earnings and cash flow. OHA's exposure is $17.7M, or 13.5% of the total fair value of its portfolio.
    • Shares are currently halted from trade.
    • SEC Form 8-K hosted on Seeking Alpha
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 7 Comments
  • HPR

    Bill Barrett to launch 11.5M-share offering

    • Bill Barrett (BBG) -7.6% AH after announcing a public offering of 11.5M common shares, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 1.725M shares.
    • BBG says it plans to use the proceeds for general corporate purposes, which may include development, deleveraging or future acquisitions.

  • MA

    Mastercard launches new $4B buyback program

    • Mastercard (NYSE:MA) approved a new share repurchase program of up to $4B worth of stock.
    • The company says it still has ~$1.3B remaining under the current program authorization.
    • MA +0.98% AH to $103.00.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 15 Comments
  • LADR

    Ladder Capital insiders cashing out

    • Something rotten in Denmark? A couple of sessions after a leak of a possible sale sent the stock sharply higher, Ladder Capital (NYSE:LADR) announces a 10M share secondary offering by certain selling shareholders. The company will presumably see no proceeds.
    • The underwriter greenshoe is for another 1.5M shares.
    • Underwriters are BAML, Deutsche, and Wells Fargo.
    • Shares -8.3% after hours
    • Previously: Ladder Capital exploring sale - Reuters (Dec. 2)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 76 Comments
  • PLAY

    Dave & Buster's soars after sizzling earnings

    • Dave & Buster's Entertainment (NASDAQ:PLAY) pops after Q3 results shine.
    • The company reports comparable sales rose 5.9% during the quarter vs. +8.8% a year ago and +2.3% consensus.
    • Adjusted EBITDA increased ~350 bps Y/Y to 21.4% of sales.
    • D&B on expansion: "During 2017, we are projecting eleven to twelve new store openings, representing unit growth of 12% to 13%. Our long-term target for annual unit growth is 10% or more and we continue to foresee a 200+ store opportunity in North America alone."
    • Previously: Dave & Buster's beats by $0.11, beats on revenue (Dec. 6)
    • PLAY +10.94% AH to $53.25.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • ZYNE

    Jefferies likes Zynerba, sees 121% upside; shares up 10%

    • Jefferies resumes coverage of Zynerba Pharmaceuticals (ZYNE +10.4%) with a Buy rating and $32 (121% upside) price target.
    • Analyst Biren Amin says positive safety data from a Phase 1 study of co-lead product candidate ZYN002, a synthetic cannabidiol gel, bodes well for future development. Specifically, it did not produce impairment in critical areas of cognitive function or declines in psychological health in healthy volunteers.
    • Current development programs include epilepsy, osteoarthritis of the knee and Fragile X Syndrome.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 3 Comments
  • KMI

    Kinder Morgan -1.5% as guidance fails to impress

    • Investors don't seem too excited about Kinder Morgan's (KMI -1.5%) 2017 financial picture, as SunTrust's Tristan Richardson says earnings guidance was a little lower than expected and that KMI said it would not announce a new dividend policy until “the latter part” of next year that would take effect in 2018.
    • Richardson says estimated 2017 distributable cash flow of $4.46B (+1% Y/Y) was 4% below SunTrust's outlook for $4.65B and below Wall Street consensus of $4.6B, 2017 adjusted EBITDA of $7.2B (flat Y/Y) was 3% below SunTrust's $7.4B and below consensus $7.35B, and the unchanged $0.50 dividend for the year was in-line with SunTrust and consensus estimates.
    • But Raymond James analyst Darren Horowitz says KMI's bullish thesis remains intact, thinking the company’s guidance could prove conservative.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM | 18 Comments
  • RCON

    Recon Technology receives patent for oilfield wastewater treatment device

    • Recon Technology (NASDAQ:RCON) announced it has been awarded a patent for its proprietary oilfield wastewater treatment device by China's State Intellectual Property Office. The patented device can separate the sewage sludge and oil pollution from crude oil within one integrative equipment and at the same time, produce water that is qualified for direct discharge, reinjection or other oil-company projects, thus significantly increasing the processing effectiveness and cost-savings of wastewater treatment.
    • In addition to this patent, the company is currently applying for several other patents designed to facilitate removal of toxic substances and metallic elements from wastewater.
    • Chairman and CEO Shenping Yin: "We started developing new products for oilfield wastewater treatment last fiscal year and have achieved preliminary business results. Two major advantages of our device and resolution are to dramatically save space and reduce costs for our clients, which are particularly attractive, given current low oil prices. We are confident that, with this new patent and our other innovative technology and business solutions in wastewater treatment, we will further enhance our strength in this high growth business segment."
    • Shares +8.9%
     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM

  • S

    Sprint +2.8% intraday on announcement SoftBank Group plans $50B U.S. investment

    • SoftBank Group has apparently pledged the figure in addition to 50,000 jobs within the country.
    • Sprint (NYSE:S) [83% owned by SoftBank Group], trading negative for the majority of the day, has moved sharply into positive territory on the development, while SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBY) shares are steadily elevating as well to 1.9% gains.
    • N.B. T-Mobile (TMUS +2.2%)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 163 Comments
  • SLM

    Soaring student lenders have room to run - KBW

    • Sallie Mae (NYSE:SLM) is higher by 49% since the election and Navient (NASDAQ:NAVI) by 27% as investors bet the incoming administration will scale back government lending, thus ceding market share to private players.
    • KBW sticks with its Outperform rating on the sector given the hopes for reduced headline risk and greater lending opportunities under Trump. The team's favorite is SLM, as its stronger earnings potential warrants a higher multiple.
    • Related: Nelnet (NYSE:NNI)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM | 2 Comments
  • ATW

    Atwood Oceanics wins delay on drillship deliveries

    • Atwood Oceanics (ATW +7.9%) surges after gaining some breathing room on payments following an agreement with Daewoo Shipbuilding to delay delivery of two newbuild ultra-deepwater drillships by two years.
    • In connection with the delay, ATW will make a $125M payment for the Atwood Archer by Dec 15 and a $15M payment by June 30, 2018; Daewoo will extend all remaining milestone payments, which include $84M plus fees and interest for the Atwood Admiral and $165M plus fees and interest for the Atwood Archer, until Dec 30, 2022.
    • ATW says the moves enhance its liquidity position by ~$250M from June 30, 2018 until final payments are made to Daewoo on Dec. 30, 2022.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM

  • OMC

    U.S. Department of Justice probes advertising industry contract process

    • The Wall Street Journal reports the department is looking at unspecified advertising agencies over business that is alleged to have been improperly directed through a manipulated bidding process for commercials production, an estimated $5B business within the United States.
    • Lower on the development – Omnicom Group (OMC -2.8%), Interpublic Group (IPG -3.6%), WPP (WPPGY -0.7%), Publicis Groupe (OTCQX:PUBGY -0.8%)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • BLUE

    Interim data shows effectiveness of bluebird bio's LentiGlobin in patients with transfusion-dependent blood disorder; shares up 7%

    • Interim results from bluebird bio's (BLUE +6.5%) Phase 1/2 Northstar (HGB-204) study assessing its LentiGlobin drug product in patients with transfusion-dependent beta thalassemia (TDT) showed a significant treatment benefit. The data are being presented at the 58th American Society of Hematology (ASH) annual meeting in San Diego.
    • TDT patients with non-beta0/beta0 genotypes who have been followed for at least 12 months have stopped regular transfusions while patients with the beta0/beta0 genotypes have experienced a median reduction of 63% in transfusion volume.
    • The company says the vector copy numbers for the first patients treated in studies HGB-207 and HGB-206 with its "new and improved" LentiGlobin (Process 2) are 2.8 and 3.3, respectively, supporting the company's rationale for revising the manufacturing process to increase yield.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM | 7 Comments

    | 1:00 PM
  • TALO

    Stone Energy offers cloudy outlook for restoration of Amethyst well

    • Stone Energy (SGY -6.3%) is lower after saying there is no assurance that its Amethyst well can be restored to previous levels or at all after being shut in during April to allow for a technical evaluation.
    • SGY says it will evaluate its options to restore production from the well, which it anticipates will continue for at least several months.
    • Estimated proved reserves associated with the Amethyst well at year-end 2015 were ~79B cfe of gas.

  • CTIC

    CTI's pacritinib meets one of two co-primary endpoints in late-stage myelofibrosis study; shares up 5%

    • A Phase 3 clinical trial, PERSIST-2, assessing CTI BioPharma's (CTIC +5.4%) pacritinib for the treatment of high-risk thrombocytopenic myelofibrosis achieved one of its two primary endpoints. The data are being presented at the 58th American Society of Hematology (ASH) annual meeting in San Diego.
    • PERSIST-2 randomized 311 subjects to receive either 200 mg of pacritinib twice daily, 400 mg of pacritinib once daily or best available therapy (BAT). The co-primary endpoints were the proportion of patients achieving at least a 35% reduction in spleen volume (SVR) from baseline to week 24 and the proportion of patients achieving at least a 50% reduction in Total Symptom Score (TSS) from baseline to week 24.
    • Pooled results for both pacritinib doses showed a statistically significant difference in SVR compared to BAT (18% vs. 3%; p=0.001). The difference in TSS favored pacritinib but was not statistically valid (25% vs. 14%; p=0.079).
    • Results for the 200 mg pacritinib cohort were statistically valid as was SVR for the 400 mg group. TSS lagged (17% vs. 14%; p=0.652).
    • There was no significant difference in overall survival across the treatment arms. Hazard ratios were 0.68 for 200 mg pacritinib vs. BAT and 1.18 for 400 mg pacritinib vs. BAT. Overall mortality rates were 9%, 14% and 14%, respectively.
    • Pacritinib, an oral tyrosine kinase inhibitor, is under development for the potential treatment of certain blood-related cancers
     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM
  • QRVO

    Raymond James reissues Qorvo at Outperform

    • Primarily on what the firm considers to be an overlooked IDP segment with exciting opportunity ahead. Further highlights base station market potential, investments in gallium nitride [GaN] on silicon carbide technology and benefits to be derived from MIMO and Massive MIMO.
    • Qorvo (NASDAQ:QRVO) shares to $53.59 on +2.11% gains at midday.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM | 1 Comment

    • Losers: SCSS -7%. COT -6%.

  • TCF

    TCF Financial a Top Pick as Barclays shifts mid-cap bank ratings

    • "Above-average" asset-sensitivity, "outsize" potential benefits from deregulation, and a cheap valuation are behind analyst Matthew Keating making TCF Financial (TCB +0.8%) a Top Pick, replacing Signature Bank (SBNY +0.3%).
    • Upgraded to Overweight is BankUnited (BKU +1.9%), with Keating noting a valuation discount, but loan growth expectations nearly double that of peers.
    • Upgraded to Equalweight from Underweight is Synovus (SNV +0.4%).
    • Downgraded to Underweight are Dime Community (DCOM -7.2%) thanks to its liability sensitivity in a rising rate environment.
    • Also cut to Underweight is Investors Bancorp (ISBC -1.5%), with Keating also noting its liability sensitivity.
    • Also on the upgrade list: Cullen/Frost (CFR +1.1%).
    • Also on the downgrade list: Fulton Financial (FULT -0.3%).
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM

  • CMG

    Highlights from Chipotle's conference presentation

    • Chipotle (CMG -7%) says it will consider firing off some menu increases next year to help it offset wage pressure.
    • Execs indicated an effort will me made to keep a lid on labor costs by setting a hiring freeze.
    • In a pair of tough observations, the presenters said the company is "nervous" about hitting its guidance and that the longer lines at stores are a result of slower throughput (line speed) not just a boost in actual traffic.
    • "I'm not satisfied with the rate of recovery and the quality of the restaurant experience," said co-CEO Steve Ells.
    • A very interesting development will be the makeup of the new Chipotle board with Bill Ackman breathing down the restaurant operator's neck. An announcement is expected shortly.
    • Sources: Bloomberg and Reuters.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 43 Comments
  • STWD

    Starwood down 3% after secondary; volume strong

    • Estimated gross proceeds of about $394.3M for the 17.8M share sale suggests a price of $22.15 each. The underwriters have an option to buy another 2.67M shares at that price.
    • STWD -2.9% to $22.23 on volume of 9M shares (average daily is 1.9M).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 26 Comments
  • OCIP

    OCI Partners gets buyout offer from OCI N.V.

    • OCI Partners (OCIP +2.7%) resumes trading following a halt after saying it had received an offer from OCI N.V. (OTC:OCINF) to buy all its remaining common units.
    • OCI proposes an exchange ratio of 0.52 OCI N.V. shares for each OCIP unit as part of a merger of OCIP with a wholly-owned subsidiary of OCI; in exchange, OCI N.V. would offer 9.1M newly issued shares, representing a value of ~$7.80/unit, or an 8.3% premium over OCIP's closing price yesterday.
    • OCI N.V. currently owns 79.88% of OCIP units.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 14 Comments
  • BOBE

    Bob Evans brings in JPMorgan to help it review options

    • Bob Evans Farms (BOBE +5.6%) says it hired JPMorgan to help it evaluate ways it can create value for shareholders.
    • The company has no timeline for the review which is presumed to include considering offers for the packaged foods business.
    • Shares of Bob Evans stretched out to a 52-week high of $50.80 earlier.
    • Previously: Bob Evans Farms beats by $0.11, misses on revenue (Dec. 5)
    • Previously: Bob Evans Farms rallies after profit beat and guidance boost (Dec. 5)

  • COT

    Coolish views on Cott

    • Cott Corporation (COT -4.1%) slides after Stifel Nicolaus lowers the beverage stock to a Hold rating after having it lined up previously at Buy.
    • The investment firm sets a price target of $12 on Cott.
    • SA contributor Terrier Investing thinks fair value on Cott is $10 or $11. Shares trade at $10.58 on last check.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • CM

    Fresh highs for PrivateBancorp - BMO says mid-$50s necessary for deal

    • CIBC (CM +0.1%) likely will need to raise its bid to the mid-$50s to land its U.S. acquisition target, PrivateBancorp (PVTB +1.9%), says BMO.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • The Canadian lender thought it had a deal for $47 in cash and stock, but a massive rally in banks helped push PVTB through that number. Now ISS is recommending shareholders vote against the deal, and Egan-Jones switched from approving to recommending against.
    • Today's gain brings PVTB to $51.70.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM

  • Avianca Holdings soars to 52-week high with bids reportedly in hand

    • Shares of Avianca Holdings soar after The New York Times reports that the company has firm bids in hand fom Delta, United and Copa Holdings.
    • The U.S.-traded ADRs are up 16.3% to $8.30 after setting a 52-week high of $8.68 earlier today.
    • Previously: Bidders step up for Avianca Holdings (Dec. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • LSCC

    U.S. Congress members request block of Lattice Semiconductor sale

    • Twenty-two members of Congress have submitted concern arguing potential for disruption of the U.S. military supply chain and induction of reliance on internationally-sourced technology for vital U.S. Department of Defense programs after direct connection between Canyon Bridge Capital Partners, the prospective buyer of Lattice Semiconductor, and China's government was highlighted.
    • With the sale of German-based Aixtron to Chinese investors blocked on U.S. ties in recent days, caution over the development is observed as Lattice Semiconductor (NASDAQ:LSCC) trades 4%+ lower early.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • JBSAF

    JBS Foods International rallies after tipping U.S. IPO

    • JBS Foods International (OTC:JBSAF, OTCQX:JBSAY) plans to list shares in the U.S.
    • Brazilian investment firm BTG Pactual thinks an IPO could be a catalyst for the company.
    • Shares of JBS are up 14% in Sao Paulo trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM | 3 Comments
  • IMMU

    New ADC from Immunomedics shows significant anti-tumor effect without excessive toxicity in preclinical studies; shares ahead 8% premarket

    • Micro cap Immunomedics (NASDAQ:IMMU) is up 8% premarket on light volume in response to its announcement of positive preclinical results from its latest antibody-drug conjugate (ADC) IMMU-140, a humanized antibody conjugated to the moderately toxic drug SN-38 using the company's proprietary CL2A linker.
    • SN-38 and CL2A are also components of Breakthrough Therapy-tagged IMMU-132 (sacituzumab govitecan) which has demonstrated positive results in a Phase 2 study in metastatic triple-negative breast cancer.
    • The preclinical work examined the activity of IMMU-140 compared to its parental antibody IMMU-114 in four cancer cell lines (AML, ALL, MM, CLL). In a mouse model of human AML, animals treated with 500 ug of IMMU-140 showed a significant increase in survival compared to control. Additionally, mice treated with IMMU-140 experienced significantly improved survival compared to those receiving IMMU-114.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers as of 9:10 am

    | 9:13 AM | 7 Comments
  • NVCN

    Early results show Neovasc's Tiara valve performing well; shares up 16% premarket

    • Nano cap Neovasc (NASDAQ:NVCN) is up 16% premarket on robust volume in response to its announcement of performance data from 22 patients with mitral regurgitation (MR) who have received the Tiara transcatheter mitral valve. The results were presented at the ICI Meeting 2016 in Tel Aviv, Israel.
    • The technical success rate was 86% (n=19/22). In the 19 successful implantations, paravalvular leak levels were either mild, trace or absent in 100% (n=19/19). All-cause 30-day mortality was 15.7% (n=3/19). The remaining three patients who have not yet reached the 30-day mark are doing well. There has been no 30-day mortality in the last eight recipients treated over one month ago.
    • The longest follow-up period is almost three years post implant and Tiara remains fully functional. No valve-related adverse events have been reported.
    • Tiara is a self-expanding bioprosthesis specifically designed to treat MR by replacing the defective valve. MR is frequently severe and can lead to heart failure and death.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM | 1 Comment
  • CMG

    Chipotle down 4% on minimum wage pressure

    • Presenting at a Barclays conference, Chipotle (NYSE:CMG) says now's not the time, but it will need to raise prices to offset increases in the minimum wage. Price increases will be considered at some point in 2017.
    • Shares -4.25% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM | 29 Comments
  • BNED

    Barnes & Noble Education crushed after earnings disappoint

    • Shares of Barnes & Noble Education (NYSE:BNED) are on watch after the company misses FQ2 estimates.
    • The company raises the low end of full-year revenue guidance to +3% to +4%, from a prior range of +2% to +4%. The consensus estimate is for a 2.7% increase.
    • "Though our new business wins enabled us to grow total sales, comparable store sales declined as a result of lower enrollments and a softer retail environment," noted CEO Max Roberts.
    • Comparable sales were down 2.9% Y/Y in Q3.
    • Previously: Barnes & Noble Education misses by $0.15, misses on revenue (Dec. 6)
    • BNED -9.84% premarket to $10.45.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM | 2 Comments
  • CLNE

    Clean Energy Fuels awarded new station construction projects

    • Clean Energy Fuels (NASDAQ:CLNE) +4.6% premarket after announcing two new fueling station construction projects and multiple projects for its Facility Modification Services division, including three for Cummins’s sales and service business.
    • CLNE says it has contracted to build compressed natural gas fueling stations in Coachella, Calif., and Frankling Township, N.J., and is awarded a contract with San Fernando, Calif., to upgrade its public CNG station.
    • CEO Andrew Littlefair says CLNE expects to complete 62 fueling station projects this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM | 23 Comments
  • P

    Pandora upgraded to Outperform at Oppenheimer & Co.; +3.5% pre-market

    • Amid reports of a potential takeout by Sirius XM Holdings, analyst Jason Helfstein moves from a prior Perform rating on Pandora (NYSE:P).
    • Considers an up to $21 per share price level for a takeover, though sets current target at $18 (pre-market price $13.84).
     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM | 6 Comments
  • SAGE

    Sage affirms 2018 NDA timeline for SAGE-547; shares ahead 8% premarket

    • Sage Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SAGE) is up 8% premarket on light volume in response to its announcement that it believes it will be able to file a New Drug Application (NDA) with the FDA sometime in 2018 seeking approval of lead product candidate SAGE-547 for the treatment of postpartum depression.
    • The company is basing its expedited development plan on the formal minutes from its breakthrough therapy meeting with the agency. It says prior Phase 2 data along with results from two current studies (202B and 202C) should be sufficient to support the filing. The clinical program will require only minor modifications, including an increase in sample size. The efficacy endpoints have been agreed upon.
    • Top-line data from the registration trials should be available in H2 2017.
    • SAGE-547 is an allosteric modulator of both synaptic (junction between nerve cells) and extra-synaptic GABAa receptors. When activated, GABAa receptors cause the neuron to hyperpolarize which inhibits neurotransmission. It is also under development for the treatment of super-refractory status epilepticus.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM
  • FRAN

    More on Francesca's Q3

    • Francesca's (NASDAQ:FRAN) reports comparable-store sales rose 7% in Q3 driven by an increase in the number of transactions both at boutiques and on-line as well as the addition of 50 net new boutiques Y/Y.
    • Ecommerce comparable sales grew 47% to $5.7M.
    • Merchandise category sales: Apparel: $63.93M (+18%); Jewelry: $26.14M (+23%); Accessories: $17.43M (+2%); Gifts: $11.64M (+7%).
    • Gross margin rate improved 160 bps to 48.2%.
    • SG&A expense rate down 90 bps to 35%.
    • Operating margin rate expanded 250 bps to 13.2%.
    • Inventory -2.5% Y/Y to $42.77M.
    • Boutique count +50 Y/Y to 669.
    • Q4 Guidance: Net sales: $143M to $148M; Comparable-store sales: low-single digit decrease to low-single digit increase; EPS: $0.33 to $0.37.
    • FY2016 Guidance: Net sales: $484M to $489M; Comparable-store sales: low-single digit decrease; EPS: $1.03 to $1.07; Shares outstanding: 38.6M; Tax rate: 37.9%; Capital expenditure: $25M to $28M; New boutiques: 64.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 AM
  • TEVA

    Investors not liking departure of Teva's Olafsson; shares down 4% premarket

    • Teva Pharmaceutical Industries (NYSE:TEVA) slumps 4% premarket on average volume in apparent reaction to the news that the head of the company's global generics unit, Siggi Olafsson plans to retire at the end of Q1 2017.
    • Bank of America regards the news as "incrementally negative" while Citigroup says the change will likely "further dampen near-term sentiment."
    • Successor Dipankar Bhattacharjee, no doubt, believes he will convince the market otherwise.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:52 AM | 22 Comments

    CFO steps down at Rent-A-Center

    • Rent-A-Center (NASDAQ:RCII) says CFO Guy Constant has resigned from the company, effective December 2.
    • Senior VP Maureeen Short has stepped in as interim CFO while the company conducts a search for a full-time replacement.
    • SEC Form 8-K

  • NKE

    Cowen cautious on Nike

    • Nike (NYSE:NKE) is giving back some of yesterday's +2.7% gain in premarket action after Cowen weighs in with a downgrade to Market Perform from Outperform.
    • Analyst John Kernan cites share loss acceleration to Under Armour and Adidas as those companies expand distribution.
    • He also warns on an elevated level of North America promotions. "NKE apparel (33% of the mix) is discounted 25% at DKS, KSS and other retailers," writes Kernan.
    • NKE -0.96% premarket to $51.35.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:42 AM | 5 Comments
  • MIK

    Michaels cuts guidance after weak results

    • Michaels (NASDAQ:MIK) cuts full-year EPS guidance to a range of $1.86 to $1.90 vs. $1.92 to $1.98 prior and $1.95 consensus.
    • The retailer expects Q4 EPS of $0.94 to $0.98 vs. $0.99 consensus.
    • During Q3, gross margin fell to 38% of sales to miss the estimate of analyst. A higher mix of promotions was a factor. SG&A expenses came in at 26.1% of sales. Operating income fell 140 bps Y/Y to 11.9%.
    • "We are disappointed our plans did not result in expected comp and earnings growth, and we have taken steps to position the fourth quarter for better performance," says CEO Chuck Rubin.
    • Previously: The Michaels Companies misses by $0.03, misses on revenue (Dec. 6)
    • MIK -6.42% premarket to $22.75.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:36 AM

    More on AutoZone's FQ1

    • AutoZone (NYSE:AZO) reports domestic same-store sales rose 1.6% in FQ1.

  • IL

    Synchronoss buying Intralinks Holdings for $821M

    • The all cash deal works out to $13 per share for Intralinks Holdings (NYSE:IL), a 15% premium to last night's close. The sale is expected to close late in Q1.
    • Alongside the purchase, Synchronoss (NASDAQ:SNCR) agrees to sell a portion of its activation business to Sequential Technology for $146M.
    • With the deals, SNCR is giving initial 2017 revenue guidance of $810M-$820M, and pro forma EPS of $2.45-$2.60. $40M of combined synergies are targeted.
    • A conference call is set for 8:30 ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:13 AM | 6 Comments
  • CONN

    More on Conn's Q3

    • Conn's (NASDAQ:CONN) reports same-store sales fell 10.1% in Q3.
    • Net sales by category: Furniture and mattress: $98.9M (-6.5%); Home appliance: $85.79M (-0.8%); Consumer electronics: $65.67M (-6.5%); Home office: $22.75M (-12.9%); Other: $4.96M (+8.2%); Repair service agreement commissions: $26.35M (+1.2%); Service revenues: $3.62M (+4.3%).
    • Credit revenue dropped 5.2% to $68.4M.
    • Furniture unit volume down 13.7% & mattress unit volume -7.3%.
    • Home appliance unit volume rose 5.6%.
    • Consumer electronic unit volume slipped 11.8%.
    • Home office unit volume declined 12.2%.
    • Retail gross margin grew 40 bps to 37.5%.
    • Operating margin squeezed 10 bps to 11%.
    • Retail store count +12 Y/Y to 113.
    • Q4 Guidance: Same-store sales: down ~10%; Retail gross margin rate: 37% to 37.5%; SG&A expense rate: 27.75% to 28.75%; Interest expense: $25.5M to $26.5M.
